name: Hidden
content:
While you’re hidden from a creature, that creature knows the space you’re in but can’t tell precisely where you are. You typically become hidden by using Stealth to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide}. When @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seeking} a creature using only imprecise senses, it remains hidden, rather than @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.1wQY3JYyhMYeeV2G]{Observed}. A creature you’re hidden from is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} to you, and it must succeed at a DC 11 flat check when targeting you with an attack, spell, or other effect or it fails affect you. Area effects aren’t subject to this flat check.

A creature might be able to use the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} action to try to observe you, as described on page 471.
